tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE actors (
	a_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
	a_name VARCHAR(50),
	a_age INT,
	a_gender CHAR(1),
	a_previous_perf VARCHAR(100),
	a_availability BOOLEAN
);

CREATE TABLE performances (
  performance_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
  actor_id UUID REFERENCES actors(actor_id),
  play_title STRING,
  role CHARACTER VARYING,
  performance_date DATE
);
CREATE TABLE actors (actor_id INT PRIMARY KEY, actor_name VARCHAR(255), actor_age INT, actor_gender VARCHAR(10), actor_bio TEXT)
CREATE TABLE performances (performance_id INT PRIMARY KEY, actor_id INT, movie_title VARCHAR(255), role_name VARCHAR(100), performance_date DATE)
CREATE TABLE availability (availability_id INT PRIMARY KEY, actor_id INT, available_date DATE, available_slots INT)
CREATE TABLE roles (role_id INT PRIMARY KEY, role_name VARCHAR(100), role_description TEXT)

CREATE TABLE Actors (
  actor_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  actor_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  age INT,
  gender VARCHAR(10),
  nationality VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Performances (
  performance_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  actor_id INT,
  role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  movie_title VARCHAR(100),
  performance_date DATE
);

CREATE TABLE Availability (
  availability_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  actor_id INT,
  role VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  available_date DATE,
  status VARCHAR(20)
);

CREATE TABLE Movies (
  movie_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  movie_title VARCHAR(100) NOT NULL,
  release_date DATE,
  genre VARCHAR(50),
  director VARCHAR(50)
);

CREATE TABLE Roles (
  role_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  role_name VARCHAR(50) NOT NULL,
  description TEXT,
  salary DECIMAL(10, 2),
  requirements TEXT
);
